title: Is it possible to move all glyphs (a one go) a few spaces to the right.
content:
I need to move all glyphs 8 points to the right for improved spacing.  
Is there any easy way of doing this across the whole font at once, without having to move each one individually?
author: djnippa

comments.content:
Sorted it.  
It was in TOOLS \> ACTION SET \> All glyphs in Font (drop menu) \> Available Actions \> Contours \> Shift \> Click the -\> arrow to add to the right side menu \> Horizontal Shift - Type 8 \> Vertical Shift -Type 0.

Then RUN

:)
Judging from the length of your instructions they seem to have hidden that function well. It's good to know where it is, for future reference.

Yes, they certainly did hide it.  
I also found lots of other useful ACTIONS in there as well, like EFFECTS \> PARALLEL.  
Which lets you thin out or widen on one, or both axis.  
You can also do multiple actions at once.  
So you can make your font bold on both axis (parallel), reduce size (scale), then shift it to it's position.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419155037im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20shot%202014-07-19%20at%2011_3628.56.11.png)

Although I've still got to work out how to increase the spacing all at once,  
may be another member has a better suggestion?

\> Although I've still got to work out how to increase the spacing all at once,

Tools \> Action Set \> Metrics \> Set Sidebearings  
then select "Increase By" and the amount.
